original_table_html:
Market share in a particular demographic group Small bottle (%) Large bottle (%)
Overall market 19 43
Male 25 38
Female 14 47
1 person household 22 44
3+ person household 20 41
Children in household 20 39
No children in household 17 46
<34 years old 37 23
55-74 years old 12 52
AB socioeconomic 17 46
E socioeconomic 17 47
summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of market share for small and large bottles across various demographic groups. The overall market shows a higher share for large bottles (43%) compared to small bottles (19%). This trend generally holds true for most segments, with notable exceptions. Females exhibit a stronger preference for large bottles (47%) than males (38%), while males show a higher market share for small bottles (25%) compared to females (14%). Households with children or multiple persons generally favor large bottles, though the difference is marginal. A significant divergence appears in age demographics: younger individuals (<34 years old) strongly prefer small bottles (37%) over large ones (23%), whereas older individuals (55-74 years old) overwhelmingly favor large bottles (52%) over small ones (12%). Socioeconomic groups AB and E show similar, moderate preferences for large bottles.
